edges.to_node_long: C3 Diverse seas: status of mammals, birds and fish
edges.rationale: Marine litter can be harmful to wildlife. C1 includes indicator for plastic ingested by fulmars.

edges.to_node_long: J1 Carbon footprint and consumer buying choices
edges.rationale: Raw materials are used in the production of goods measured by J1.

edges.to_node_long: E6 Volume of timber brought to market each year
edges.rationale: Raw material consumption includes biomass products such as timber.
If not handled properly, waste can cause serious pollution of the environment – air, land and water.

edges.to_node_long: B2 Serious pollution incidents to water
edges.rationale: If not handled properly, waste can cause serious pollution of the environment – air, land and water.
J6 includes fly tipping which could result in marine litter.

edges.to_node_long: G1 Changes in landscape and waterscape character
edges.rationale: Fly tipping will influence changes in the public’s perceptions of landscape character and quality, which will become part of the G1 indicator.
G6 will include information on people’s self-reported environmental behaviours, likely including questions on waste.

edges.to_node_long: J1 Carbon footprint and consumer buying choices
edges.rationale: G6 will include information on people’s self-reported environmental behaviours, likely including questions on behaviours related to carbon use.
